title: The article "How to create and use mailing lists on Thunderbird" doesn't work on version 102.12.0 (64-bit)
content:
I can no longer use Contact Lists to send emails as I used to be able to do. [I'm using a PC running Windows 11 Home and Thunderbird 102.12.0 (64-bit).) The article https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-create-and-use-mailing-lists-thu... relates to version 102 & Windows 8 - and used to work for me. "Create a mailing list - Option 2:" doesn't work for selecting more than one entry. I can drag a single entry to the new Contact List but have to be careful about clicking on it or else the entry opens for editing.

"Create email using a mailing list - Via the Address Book" no longer works: - On the Mail Toolbar, locate 'Address Book'. [OK] - Click Address Book to open it. [OK] - Select the mailing list. [OK] - Click the Write button. [BUT there is no Write button; the only options above the addresses are New Address Book | New Contact | New List | Import] [I tried right-clicking on the Contact List that I want to use but the only options are Properties | Print... | Export... | Delete and Default start-up directory] "Create email using a mailing list - Via a new Write message" does seem to work - but as the article says, "You cannot see individual contacts. This saves you from needing to change eg. To to Bcc, but you cannot edit any names from that email using this method."
creator: EmmBee

title: Including Thunderbird to Apple Calendar with Google Mail Account - NO iCloud
content:
Hello together, I'am trying to integrate Thunderbird to my iMac Calendar - so synchronise a necessary Google Calendar into my iMac Calendar. Yes, this is "normally" direct possible - but no with Mac OS 10.13.6 So, I create my Thunderbird Account - everything is working, changed the Account to SSL/TLs and OAuth2.

Now, when I'am trying to make a new Account in my iMac Calendar - Accounts - "+" - Mail Account and set all necessary details - I'am getting always the same error, even on an iMac with Mac OS 10.15.7 (see picture).

Has someone an idea!?

Many thanks and best Regards from Germany Gordon

title: paste to multiple messages
content:
Thunderbird 102.12.0 on Macbook.

My intent was to send similar content to two separate addresses, having both messages visible to compare before sending. From the same email address.

I did a Copy to the clipboard of part of an email message. I then did a Write to one address and Pasted that content into that message. Without sending, I did a second Write to another address and did a Paste into the second message. (Two Send windows open.) While the Edit>Paste link flashed, and I also tried this from this menu item not just command-V, no content from the clipboard was pasted into the second message.

I did a Save of the first message. (One Send window now open.) I was then able to Paste into the second message.
creator: mfcat.fi

The other problem is that we have a REALLY OLD version of Thunderbird that doesn't have the export feature (we purchased this business a couple years ago, I don't think the computer will allow tbird updates). Does anyone know of a way to retain the emails and keep the in depth folder system we have? Thanks in advance!

title: undeleting emails
content: When my cat walked across my keyboard and somehow deletes multiple emails from my inbox, I started searching for a way to undelete them. The only icon for the trash folder I can find is the one that's labeled "Empty Trash". I've searched Firebird Help for terms like "undelete" and "access trash folder", "retrieve from trash", etc etc, but have found no mention of this common problem, or the common solution that so many other applications have. I also searched settings for "trash" but found nothing related. What am I doing wrong?
creator: TWalker99

title: Not receiving incoming emails on Thunderbird, I get an Error
content:
I used Mozilla Thunderbird to pull my email from my godaddy email account. It has been working fine for the last 6 months or so since godaddy converted to using Microsoft 365. Yesterday morning around 9:13am it stopped working I was getting emails before that then all of a sudden errors kept popping up. It is still letting me send emails so it must just be an issue with the incoming server. I've gotten multiple different error pop ups while trying to retrieve my incoming mail. I tried resetting my password a couple times even. I have been using the Microsoft 365 log in right now but I don't like the email/outlook set up and none of my folders are in it so I would like to get back on the Thunderbird. Please help!

These are the 3 errors I'm getting.

-Sending of password for user carla@aceequipmentcompany.com did not succeed. Mail server outlook.office365.com responded: Authentication failure: unknown user name or bad password.

-Login to server outlook.office365.com with username carla@aceequipmentcompany.com failed.

-Sending of password for user carla@aceequipmentcompany.com did not succeed. Mail server outlook.office365.com responded: Connection is closed. 12

Can anyone help??

title: odd cross association between two TB mail accounts
content:
With two TB IMAP email accounts, I am seeing incorrect return paths in the headers and sent mail copies from one account. Both are google accounts, B is a business google account and A is a personal gmail account.

Email sent from account B is delivered to the proper address, but with a return path to account A. So all replies are coming back to the wrong account.

I have double checked the setting for Copies & Folder and both stipulate unique locations. I have even tried to specify the correct B email in the Reply-to Address. Copies of the sent email are saved in the Gmail Sent Mail folders on BOTH accounts! The header in the copy in the A Sent Mail shows it is from my personal account, not my business account!

I notice one odd thing -- This seems to have started happening when I switched business domain registrars and moved business email from godaddy to dreamhost. Sent mail copies had previously been saved to the regular Sent folder but after editing the settings for the mail server, it switched to the Gmail Sent Mail folder. Could that have anything to do with it?

(I'm not all that knowledgeable with the technical end, just enough to probably get myself in trouble.)

Thanks in advance for any advice/suggestions.
creator: michael9383

title: Folder Containing Messages Displays as Empty
content:
Hi,

I have a folder that receives messages from manually dragging messages into it or from filter rules. Previously the folder showed lots of messages but now it displays as empty. However when I display the properties of the folder (screen shot attached) I see 4445 messages and 254 MB on disk. When I look at the folder file the size is 266,023,603. If I click Repair Folder nothing happens. I checked the filters in msgFilterRules and the only actions for that folder are "Move to folder" and "Mark read".

How can I get the messages in the folder to display correctly?

Thanks, Mike

title: Godaddy acount to open in thunderbird
content:
I tried to update my godaddy domain account to operate with my Thunderbird email client. Godaddy now uses Microsoft 365 as the set up interface and it has required changed in the setup, which i followed.

The changes were successful on my desktop, however, when I set up my laptop using the identical information, I couldn not receive emails to my inbox. I can request emails and it does send log on information, but no emails appear. I can successfully send emails from this account to other addresses.


Settings I used are: POP 3 server name - outlook.office365.com port 995 user name - barry@bbongiovi.com connection - SSL/TLS Auth - OAuth2

I had the same results when trying to set up with IMAP

Please help! Barry Bongiovi
